Rule-based text processing and deep learning based text processing are two different techniques used for text analysis. 

Rule-based text processing involves the use of predefined rules or patterns to analyze and manipulate text data. These rules are typically written by human experts, who define how certain words or phrases should be recognized and processed. This technique is often used in applications where the rules can be easily defined and updated. For example, a rule-based system may be used to identify spam emails by recognizing certain keywords or phrases that are commonly associated with spam.

On the other hand, deep learning based text processing uses machine learning algorithms to automatically learn and extract features from text

Substantive law and procedural law are two distinct branches of law that serve different purposes.
